item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1157 points | 352 comments)
2. Is Tor still safe to use? (256 points | 193 comments)
3. Comic Mono (44 points | 13 comments)
4. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (147 points | 22 comments)
5. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (177 points | 90 comments)
6. Llama 3.1 Omni Model (95 points | 7 comments)
7. Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models (100 points | 20 comments)
8. Meticulous (YC S21) is hiring to eliminate UI tests ( | hide)
9. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (141 points | 62 comments)
10. Cloudflare misidentifies Hetzner IPs as being located in Iran (85 points | 36 comments)
11. LinkedIn is now using everyone's content to train their AI tool (101 points | 34 comments)
12. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (125 points | 34 comments)
13. Show HN: I made crowdwave – imagine Twitter/Reddit but every post is a voicemail (58 points | 29 comments)
14. OpenTelemetry and vendor neutrality: how to build an observability strategy (31 points | 9 comments)
15. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (35 points | 21 comments)
16. OpenAI Threatening to Ban Users for Asking Strawberry About Its Reasoning (205 points | 149 comments)
17. Text makeup – a tool to decode and explore Unicode strings (19 points | discuss)
18. A overview of binaries, ELF, and NoMMU on Linux (39 points | discuss)
19. Microplastics in the olfactory bulb of the human brain (97 points | 83 comments)
20. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (221 points | 94 comments)
21. RabbitMQ 4.0 Released (179 points | 67 comments)
22. The Dune Shell (145 points | 43 comments)
23. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1422 points | 698 comments)
24. Meta AI: "The Future of AI Is Open Source and Decentralized" (142 points | 69 comments)
25. Senate Vote Tomorrow Could Give Helping Hand to Patent Trolls (127 points | 26 comments)
26. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (76 points | 55 comments)
27. Holding a Program in One's Head (2007) (66 points | 46 comments)
28. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (72 points | 7 comments)
29. IBM is quietly axing jobs, source says (48 points | 34 comments)
30. GM electric vehicles can now access Tesla Superchargers (89 points | 59 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
